title: Catholic Charities – Dioceses of Charlotte
description:
Adoption, burial services, children/youth, family
enrichment, food and clothing, immigration and
citizenship services, mental health counseling,
pregnancy support, refugee and language, social
concerns and advocacy, case management for supportive
services, supportive services for veterans’ families

title: Family Services Forsyth County
description:
Professional services and participating in partnerships
that foster the development of children, advance the
safety, security and success of families and individuals,
and help build a sustainable community.

title:
Forsyth County Department of Social Services / Child
Daycare / Child Support
description:
Provides subsidized child day care for eligible families
who are working or in job training and need assistance
in caring for their children, ages birth to 12.

title: Smart Start of Forsyth County
address: 7820 N. Pointe Boulevard, Suite 200, W-S, NC
description:
Public/private partnership corporation that works to
ensure that children, birth to five are prepared for
success in school and life. Smart Start of Forsyth
County is the local partner organization serving
children and families throughout Forsyth County.

title: Dream Center of Forsyth County
description:
Care & Share Food Pantry, Redress Boutique/clothing,
Outreach Alliance for Babies, Inc., Family Life
Counseling, 12-step Celebrate Recovery program

title: Dress for Success Winston-Salem
description:
Volunteers will work with you to help you choose an
interview outfit and will also provide guidance and
support.

title: Goodwill Retail Stores
description: Clothing, household items, etc., at reduced prices

title: Salvation Army Thrift Stores
description: Great prices on clothing, home good, and electronics.

title: Success Outfitters (Goodwill of NWNC)
description:
Provides people with limited resources a way to obtain
appropriate clothing for interviews and working on-the-
job at no cost.

title: Sunnyside Ministries
description:
Food & clothing, financial assistance, food pantry,
clothing center, Experience the Warmth program.
Providing hope through service, education, and
empowerment to those in need within the community.

title: The Shalom Project
description:
Clothing closet, food pantry, medical clinic and
pharmacy, Flourish (poverty / financial insecurity
program), PCCI program(affordable housing), medical
benefits.

title: Winston-Salem Rescue Mission
description:
Addiction recovery, food pantry/meal programs,
clothing, medical/dental, holiday food boxes, thrift
store.

title: Forsyth Technical Community College
description:
Technical, transfer, adult basic education, corporate and
continuing education programs

title: Goodwill Industries of NWNC
description:
Array of targeted skills training programs, largely in
partnership with the community college system. These
short-term programs train students to become
employable in high demand fields.

title:
Job Corps Scholars Program – Winston-Salem State
University
address:
601 S. Martin Luther King, Jr Drive, Winston-Salem,
NC
description:
Financial support and assistance, career development
services. Ages 16-24 in Forsyth, Davidson, Davie,
Guildford and Wake Counties.

title: NCWorks Career Center of Forsyth County
description:
Adult and youth training/re-training, scholarship
opportunities for unemployed and underemployed
individuals through the Workforce Investment
Opportunity Act, powered by Goodwill NWNC

title: NextGen Youth Services
description:
Aims to provide a structure and sense of
accomplishment in the lives of youth served. The
program is comprised of two main components:
education and employment. Completion of a secondary
educational program is the primary goal. Staff members
also provide post-secondary education counseling and
career preparation guidance. NextGen serves youth
ages 16-24 in Buncombe, Caswell, Davie, Forsyth,
Rockingham, Stokes, Surry, Transylvania, and Yadkin
Counties. Powered by Goodwill NWNC.

title: Top Priority Community Outreach Services
description:
Youth and adult services, research and training.
Promote successful and healthy living by focusing on the
wrap around effects and engaging the entire family and
community. Teach applied behavior skills to health
services professionals to improve patient outcomes
through improved adherence.

title: N.C. Division of Services for the Blind
description:
Provides services to people who are visually impaired,
blind and deaf to help them reach their goals and
independence and employment.

title: N.C. Division of Vocational Rehabilitation Services
description:
Provides counseling, training, education, transportation,
job placement, assistive technology, and other support
services to people with disabilities.

title: NCWorks Career Center of Forsyth County
description:
NCWorks Career Centers offer a wide variety of services
to help individuals at every step of the job search
journey, all of which are free of charge. Special
populations include: veterans, young adult,
apprenticeships, former offenders, agricultural workers,
limited-English, foreign trade, unemployment insurance
benefits.

title:
Senior Community Service Employment Program
(SCSEP)
description:
Community service and work-based job training
program for older Americans. Provides training for low-
income, unemployed seniors.

title: AIDS Care Services
description:
Health and social services agency providing a broad
range of programs and services for clients infected and
affected by HIV/AIDS.

title: Amos Cottage
description:
Early Childhood Intervention services for families with
children age 36 months and under that are showing
signs of developmental delay or who have a diagnosed
mental or physical condition that has a high probability
of resulting in developmental delay.

title: Alternative Behavior Strategies
description:
Must have Medicaid or Medicare. Psychological
assessments for children who are struggling to meet
developmental milestones, have encountered learning
January 11, 2023 8
problems, or do not appear to be able to function as
independently as other children their age.

title: Bethesda Center
description:
Day/Night shelters, case management – individuals
with disability conditions – mental/health conditions,
chronic homelessness

title: Birthright of Winston-Salem
description:
Free pregnancy services. Pregnancy testing, ultrasound
information, referrals, personal help/support.

title: Catholic Charities – Dioceses of Charlotte
description:
Adoption, burial services, children/youth, family
enrichment, food and clothing, immigration and
citizenship services, mental health counseling,
pregnancy support, refugee and language, social
concerns and advocacy, case management for supportive
services, supportive services for veterans’ families

title: Community Alternative Program for Disabled Adults, by N.C. Department of Health and Human Services
description:
Adults, 17 years and older, with disabilities who prefer
to remain in their primary private residences rather
than nursing home placement. The services are
intended for situations where no household member,
relative, caregiver, landlord, community, agency,
volunteer agency or third-party payer is able or willing
to meet all medical, psychosocial and functional needs of
the beneficiary.

title:
Centers for Exceptional Children - Family Support
Network of Greater Forsyth
description:
Family support network, infant and toddler, pre-K and
elementary enrichment, out-of-school time. Strives to
care for children with developmental delays, orthopedic
disabilities, and/or other long-term chronic health
impairments to prepare for independent, productive,
and fulfilling lives.

title: Crisis Control Ministries
description:
Food assistance, pharmacy assistance, financial
assistance, advocacy. Bilingual services available.

title: El Buen Pastor Latino Community Services
description:
Parent-Child Education Program provides literacy and
education to allow low-income immigrant families to
escape generational poverty and encourage families to
help each child earn a high school diploma.

title: Experiment in Self-Reliance
description:
Housing services, individual/family financial literacy
education/support, free tax preparation, low-income self-
sufficiency programs. Bilingual services.

title: Family Services Forsyth County
description:
Professional services and participating in partnerships
that foster the development of children, advance the
safety, security and success of families and individuals,
and help build a sustainable community.

title: Family Services of the Piedmont
description:
Focused on building safe and healthy families in the
Piedmont Triad addressing issues such as: domestic
violence, child abuse, mental health, and financial
stability.

title: Forsyth County Department of Social Services
description:
Adult services, family & children services, economic
services, child support, Low Income Energy Assistance
program

title:
Helping 2 Advocate 2 Research 2 Respond 4 You
Veteran Community Outreach Services
description:
Supported Employment and Empowerment Programs
(S.E.E.P.) provides supportive services to veterans,
members of our Armed Services and their eligible family
members. These services are also available to members
of the National Guards and Reservists.

title: Hispanic League
description:
Foster diversity and raise awareness by serving as a
liaison between the non-Hispanic and Hispanic
communities, Promotes community inclusion, education,
health, and multi-cultural understanding.

title: Hospice of the Piedmont
description:
Hospice care, palliative care, and grief support services
for patients, their families, and caregivers.

title:
Independent Living Services for the Blind by NC
Department of Health and Human Services
description:
Comprehensive, quality services to assist you in
adjusting to your vision loss and learning to live
independently and safely in your home and community.

title:
N.C. Cooperative Extension, Family and Consumer
Sciences Program
description:
To improve the well-being of the family through
programs that educate, influence public policy, and help
families put research-based knowledge to work in their
lives. A community based educational program that
strengthens & transforms families by providing
education on the most important issues that affect
them. The core of all NC State Extension county FCS
programs is nutrition, health, food safety, food
preservation, & local foods systems.

title: North Star LGBTQ Community Center
description:
Seeks to empower and enrich the lives of LGBTQ people
in the Triad area. Offers various social, support, and
educational opportunities for adults and youth

title: RHA Health Services
address: 8460 Belews Creek Road, Belews Creek, NC
description:
Must have Medicare or Medicaid. Work with an
emphasis for Intellectual Disability Care to help people
live in their own homes, control their own lives, and be
members of their home communities in a residential
setting.

title: Senior Services
description:
Help older adults remain at home for as long as possible
and to help them live with dignity. With concern for
those who care for senior adults, we also help caregivers
through services and education that will benefit them.
Elizabeth and Tab Williams Adult Day Center, Meals on
Wheels, Help Line, Home Care, Senior Lunch, Living at
Home, Elder Care Choices.

title: Solutions for Independence
description:
Work with individuals to learn skills that enhance their
ability to live independently. Individual or group
training on a variety of topics is available.

title: The Salvation Army of Winston-Salem
description:
Family, emergency, homeless shelter, food pantry, Boys
& Girls Club, overcome poverty, rent/utilities
assistance, Angel Tree, emergency disaster services.

title: The Shalom Project
description:
Clothing closet, food pantry, medical clinic and
pharmacy, Florish (poverty / financial insecurity
program), PCCI program(affordable housing), medical
benefits.

title: The Shepard’s Center of Greater Winston-Salem
description:
Promotes and supports successful aging by providing
direct services, volunteer opportunities, and enrichment
programs for older adults.

title: United Way of Forsyth County
address: 301 N. Main Street, Suite 1700, Winston-Salem, NC
description:
Create a thriving community by investing in
neighborhoods and households with a specific focus on
creating equitable communities, improving economic
mobility, and ensuring childhood and student success.

title: Winston-Salem Urban League
description:
Empowers and advocates for African Americans and
other disenfranchised communities, and promotes
socioeconomic progress and parity through education,
training, and civic engagement.

title: Winston-Salem Rescue Mission
description:
Addiction recovery, food pantry/meal programs,
clothing, medical/dental, holiday food boxes, thrift store.

title: Crisis Control Ministries
description:
Food assistance, pharmacy assistance, financial
assistance, advocacy. Bilingual services available.

title: Family Services of the Piedmont
description:
Focused on building safe and healthy families in the
Piedmont Triad addressing issues such as: domestic
violence, child abuse, mental health, and financial
stability.

title: Financial Pathways of the Piedmont
address: 7820 N. Point Boulevard, Suite 100, Winston-Salem, NC
description:
Trained and certified credit and housing counselors are
ready to provide the financial guidance and support
your need. Financial literacy and education.

title: N.C. Division of Employment Security
description:
Unemployment insurance benefits for claimants and
employers.

title: The CARes Project
description:
Help people become financially secure through car
ownership, by making community-funded vehicle loans,
and by building skills through financial and credit
coaching.

title: The Salvation Army
description:
Emergency financial assistance for rent and utilities to
help households prevent homelessness.

title: Sunnyside Ministry
description:
Financial assistance to qualifying neighbors for: housing
– mortgages (must bring foreclosure information), rent
(must bring an eviction notice), and first month’s rent
(must bring a receipt for the rental deposit). Utilities –
power, gas, and water (must bring a disconnect notice).
Utility deposits are included in the assistance we
provide. You must reside in 27107, 27127 of Forsyth
County or Northern Davidson County. Contact
Sunnyside Ministry for specific service area information
For Financial Literacy Education - you must reside in
Forsyth or Davidson Counties.

title: Agape Care and Share Ministries
description:
Clothing closet, food pantry, medical clinic and
pharmacy, Flourish (poverty / financial insecurity
program), PCCI program(affordable housing), medical
benefits.

title: American Red Cross – Western NC Region
description:
Serving Forsyth County. Emergency food. Disaster
relief focuses on meeting people's immediate emergency
disaster-caused needs.

title: Client Choice Food Pantries - Crisis Control Ministries
description:
Food assistance, pharmacy assistance, financial
assistance, advocacy. Bilingual services available.

title: Samaritan Ministries
description:
Open to men, women, and children who want a hot meal
with no questions asked.

title: Second Harvest Food Bank NWNC
description:
Provide essential food assistance through a network of
partners and to educate and engage communities in the
elimination of hunger and its causes.

title: Sunnyside Ministries
description:
Food & clothing, financial assistance, food pantry,
clothing center, Experience the Warmth program.
Providing hope through service, education, and
empowerment to those in need within the community.

title: The Shalom Project
description:
Clothing closet, food pantry, medical clinic and
pharmacy, Flourish (poverty / financial insecurity
program), PCCI program(affordable housing), medical
benefits.

title: A Hallmark Women’s Clinic
description:
Judgment-free assistance when needed the most.
Appointments for surgical are taken within 72 hours,
and non-surgical abortion services are available from 3
weeks to 20 weeks.

title: Al-Anon Alateen of Winston-Salem – AA
description:
A mutual support program for people whose lives have
been affected by their own drinking. By sharing common
experiences and applying the AA principles alcoholics
can bring positive changes to their individual situations.

title: Atrium Health - Wake Forest Baptist Hospital
description:
Encompasses Brenner’s Children’s Hospital, the
Comprehensive Cancer Center, and 4 network hospitals.
Wake Forest Baptist also operates 3 urgent care
centers, 5 emergency departments and more than 350
primary and specialty clinics.

title: Burgess Wellness
description: Addiction assistance and recovery.

title: Cancer Services
description:
Davie, Forsyth, Stokes, and Yadkin Counties. providing
comprehensive financial, physical and social support
services to individuals facing any type of cancer in our
community. Limited emergency financial assistance
may be available on a case by case basis, in conjunction
with accessing resources from other local crisis agencies.

title: Community Low Vision Center
description:
One-of-a-kind resource for people with conditions like
age-related macular degeneration, glaucoma, cataracts
or diabetic retinopathy.

title: Crisis Control Ministries
description:
Serves residents of Forsyth and Stokes Counties.
Largest free pharmacy in Forsyth County. It is located
at our Winston-Salem office.

title: Daymark Recovery Services
description:
To inspire and empower people to seek and maintain
recovery and health.

title: Department of Public Health, Forsyth County
description: Environmental Health, nursing, preventative care.

title: Hawley House by YMCA of Winston-Salem
description:
Women’s Substance Abuse Recovery Facility that
houses women for a period of 9-12 months and offers 6
months of aftercare for women ages 18 and older
diagnosed with the disease of addiction.

title: Be Smart Family Planning by N.C. Department of Health and Human Services
description:
Reduces unintended pregnancies and improves the well-
being of children and families in North Carolina.

title: Eliza’s Helping Hands
description:
Counseling, specialized therapy, substance abuse
counseling, vision care.

title: Highland Avenue Primary Care Clinic
description:
Serving Forsyth County residents. Medical care for
patients of all ages.

title: Mental Health Association in Forsyth County
description:
Crisis Intervention, short-term counseling, mental
illness, hospital outreach program, court assistance
programs, referral services, campaigns and
prevention trainings, Operation Santa Claus,
advocacy.

title: Monarch
description:
Provide individualized services for people with
intellectual and developmental disabilities and mental
illnesses as well as support and counseling for those
with substance use challenges.

title: N.C. MedAssist
description:
Free prescription medications to North Carolina
residents who are uninsured and fall at or below 300%
of the Federal Poverty Level. This statewide program is
the answer for those who do not have the means to
obtain life-saving medications to treat chronic diseases
such as, heart disease, diabetes, and asthma.

title: Novant Health – Forsyth Medical Center
description:
Integrated system of 15 medical centers and more than
1,800 physicians in over 800 locations, as well as
numerous outpatient surgery centers, medical plazas,
rehabilitation programs, diagnostic imaging centers and
community health outreach programs.

title: Old Vineyard behavioral Health Services
description:
Variety of behavioral health services in W-S, NC, to
help those in need get the treatment they deserve.

title: Pinnacle Family Services
description:
Must have Medicaid. child and family services agency
serving families in North Carolina and Florida. We
specialize in providing community-based behavioral
health services, including Family Centered Treatment,
Therapeutic Foster Care (Fostering Solutions),
Intensive In-Home Services, In Home Therapy Services
(limited locations), and Outpatient Plus Services
(limited locations).

title: Planned Parenthood South Atlantic
description:
Serve clients' reproductive and sexual health care
needs.

title: Project Cornerstone by Samaritan Ministries
description:
Long-term recovery program for former substance
abusers. Men live at Samaritan while overcoming
addictions, developing job and life skills and work
toward becoming self-sufficient.

title: Rising Hope Clinical Assistance, LLC
description:
Outpatient therapy program that offers individual and
group counseling to support peoples’ recovery and help
them develop the skills needed to cope with life’s
struggles.

title: Salem Pregnancy Care Center
description:
Free and confidential services. A safe refuge for hurting
women who find themselves in an unplanned
pregnancy.

title: Senior Services Inc., Home Care Program
description:
Help Line, Home Care, Living at Home, Meals on
Wheels, Senior Lunch Program, Adult Day Center,
Elder Care Choices

title: Triad Therapy LLC
description:
Outpatient therapy and diagnostic assessments,
enhanced services such as community support team and
intensive in-home.

title: Top Priority Care Services
description:
Variety of services to both children/adolescents and
adults. Evidence-Based Treatment approaches are
utilized to provide the most appropriate treatment
relating to Substance Abuse, Mental Illnesses, Family
Crisis, Behavioral Problems, and Developmental
Disabilities.

title:
Una Voz Para La Salud (Call for Health) by National
Center for Farmworker Health
description:
Helps agricultural workers (farmworkers) and their
families find health services in their area in the US.

title: WebMD
description:
Prescription discount cards provide discounted
prescription medication. Helps individuals save money
every month on most prescription drugs at participating
pharmacies across the U.S

title: World Relief Triad
description:
Serves immigrants and refugees. On-site therapy and
counseling, and individual and family case management
services for refugee and immigrant clients with serious
or acute medical needs.

title: YMCA of Northwest NC
description:
Programs designed to help community members reach
for peak health

title: Baptist Children’s Homes – Mills Home in Thomasville
description:
Serves Forsyth County. Offers supportive group homes
for hard-working single mothers and their children

title: Bethesda Center
description:
Emergency day and night shelter facilities to the
homeless men and women in Winston Salem. We
recognize the importance of offering a safe place where
people are protected from inclement weather – the snow
and freezing rain of winter as well as the oppressive
heat of summer.

title: City with Dwellings
description:
A community first initiative that works to end the crisis
of homelessness in W-S and Forsyth County.

title: Community Alternatives, Inc.
description:
Serves Winston-Salem. Provides single-house living.
These are Medicaid Waiver-funded residential
placements for consumers with intellectual and
January 11, 2023 22
developmental disabilities in small group home
environments.

title: Cooperative Community Ministry – Thomasville
description:
Financial assistance for rent, utilities and deposits.
Covers Forsyth County.

title:
EHH Emergency Shelter and Transitional housing
Program by Eliza’s Helping Hands
description:
Provides free services in a secure and non-disclosed
location to victims and survivors of domestic and sexual
violence and their dependents, who will be part of a safe
and uplifting commune, free of judgment. Residents will
also have the opportunity to seek safe shelter for their
pets through a partnering humane society and gain
access to more permanent housing solutions through
Eliza’s transitional housing program, or similar
programs in the community.

title: Experiment in Self-Reliance
description:
Provides temporary accommodations for the working
homeless, and works to transition clients into
permanent, affordable residences.

title:
Finish Line Grant by Forsyth Technical Community
College
description:
Helps community college students who face unforeseen
financial emergencies to complete their training. Bills
submitted for payment may include automobile repairs
or insurance, utility bills, unexpected medical bills,
childcare expenses, and course materials. Each student
recipient is limited to $1,000 per semester and must
have completed at least 50% of their degree or
credential program.

title: Forsyth County Department of Social Services
description:
Assists individuals and families who are experiencing a
heating or cooling related crisis.

title: Habitat of Humanity for Forsyth County
description:
Empowers families as they work toward becoming first-
time homeowners. The families purchase their homes
through an affordable 30-year loan. Their mortgage
payments enable Habitat to continue the cycle, building
more homes for Partner Families.

title: Housing Authority of Winston-Salem
description:
Federal government's major program for assisting very
low-income families, the elderly, and the disabled to
afford decent, safe, and sanitary housing in the private
market. Serves Winston-Salem.

title:
Low Income Energy Assistance Program and Household
Water Assistance Program by NC Department of Health
and Human Services
description:
Provides for a one-time vendor payment to help eligible
households pay their heating bills and temporary
emergency program that help eligible households afford
water and wastewater services.

title: Neighbors for Better Neighbors
description:
Provides direct assistance to individuals and families in
need residing in the East Ward of North Carolina.

title: Next Step Ministries
description:
Emergency safe house in Forsyth County for survivors
of domestic violence and their children. Food and other
daily essentials such as diapers and laundry detergent
are provided free of charge.

title: Oak Forest United Methodist Church
description:
Aids church and community members by paying the
power company or leaser directly to ensure power and
shelter continues.

title: Positive Wellness Alliance
description:
Emergency financial relief to help with rent, utilities,
medication, nutrition, transportation to medical
appointments, and other essential needs.

title: Samaritan Inn Shelter by Samaritan Ministries
description:
Serves homeless men who need safe, temporary shelter
for a maximum of 90 days. All shelter guests are
referred to appropriate agencies for further assistance
with medical care, job training, temporary housing and
other needs.

title:
The Center of Hope Family Shelter by Salvation Army
of Greater Winston-Salem
description:
Only family emergency shelter in Forsyth County. It
provides a safe refuge and the resources to give families
and individuals a fresh start and a return to permanent
housing and stability. The Center of Hope gives shelter
to single mothers, single fathers, parents with children,
and single women.

title: United Way of Winston-Salem
description:
The goal of the SSVF Program is to promote housing
stability among very low-income Veteran families who
reside in or are transitioning to permanent housing.

title: Veterans Helping Veterans Heal
description:
Provides fully furnished living quarters and the
comradery and support of being in an environment
with other veterans.

title: Better Business Bureau of Central and NW NC
description:
Provide reports on business firms and help resolve
consumers’ disputes with businesses.

title: Legal Aid of North Carolina
description:
A statewide, non-profit law firm that provides free, legal
services in civil matters to low-income people in order to
ensure equal access to justice and to remove legal
barriers to economic opportunity.

title: National Labor Relations Board
description:
Independent agency of the federal government of the
United States with responsibilities for enforcing U.S.
labor law in relation to collective bargaining and unfair
labor practices.

title: N.C. Labor Board
description:
Promotes the health, safety and general well-being of
workers in NC.

title: U.S. Department of Labor
description:
Responsible for the administration of federal laws
governing occupational safety and health, wage and
hour standards, unemployment benefits, reemployment
services, and occasionally, economic statistics.

title: City of Winston-Salem – City Hall
description: Winston Salem City government.

title: Forsyth County Board of Elections
description: Voter and election resources.

title: Forsyth County Government Center
description: Forsyth County government.

title: Greater Winston-Salem, Inc.
description: Promoting business and economic development in Winston - Salem.

title: U.S. Social Security Administration
description:
Administers Social Security, a social insurance program
consisting of retirement, disability and survivor
benefits.

title: Winston-Salem Chamber of Commerce
description: Chamber of Commerce Winston - Salem

title: Allegiance Transportation Services
description:
Non-emergency medical transportation specializing in
wheelchair and ambulatory services.

title: Piedmont Authority for Regional Transportation (PART)
description:
Enhance all forms of transportation in the Piedmont
Triad Region. Our work is part of a larger statewide
effort to improve transportation systems in North
Carolina. Working with our partners, we strive to
enhance mobility, address congestion, and reduce
transportation related impacts on our air quality.

title: Safe Ride Transportation
description:
Provides wheelchair and special needs transportation
services for handicapped, senior, and disabled clients.

title: Support Systems of Forsyth County LLC
description:
Transportation services. Supports issues and barriers to
mobility and stability in the community.

title: Winston-Salem Transit Authority
description: High level public transportation services.
